sen.j: 大川神社（おおかわじんじゃ）は、京都府舞鶴市大川にある神社である。
sen.e: "Okawa-jinja Shrine" is a shrine in Okawa, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
"Okawa-jinja Shrine" is a shrine in Okawa, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
"Okawa-jinja Shrine" is a shrine in Okawa, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 社格は式内社（名神大社）、府社。
sen.e: Its shrine ranking is shikinai-sha (shrine listed in the Engishiki (List of Official Shrines)) (myojin-taisha shrine), prefectural shrine.
Its shrine ranking is shikinai-sha (shrine listed in the Engishiki - List of Official Shrines) (myojin-taisha shrine), prefectural shrine.
Its shrine ranking is shikinai-sha (shrine listed in the Engishiki - List of Official Shrines) (myojin-taisha shrine), prefectural shrine.

tit.cmt: 複数あるため"deities"としました。

sen.e: Chief god Ukemochi no kami
Chief god Ukemochi no kami
Chief god Ukemochi no kami

sen.j: 相殿 句句廼馳神（木神）、軻遇突智神（火神）、埴山姫神（土神）、金山彦神（金神）、罔象水神（水神）
sen.e: Aidono (enshrinement of two or more deities in one building of a shrine) Kukunochi no kami (god of trees), Kagutsuchi no kami (god of fire), Haniyamahime no kami (god of earth), Kanayamahiko no kami (god of gold), Mizuha suijin (god of water)

Aidono (enshrinement of two or more deities in one building of a shrine) Kukunochi no kami (god of trees), Kagutsuchi no kami (god of fire), Haniyamahime no kami (god of earth), Kanayamahiko no kami (god of gold), Mizuha suijin (god of water)

Aidono (enshrinement of two or more deities in one building of a shrine) Kukunochi no kami (god of trees), Kagutsuchi no kami (god of fire), Haniyamahime no kami (god of earth), Kanayamahiko no kami (god of gold), Mizuha suijin (god of water)

sen.j: 社伝によれば、「顕宗天皇乙丑年（485年）に宮柱を立て鎮祭、神位は貞観 (日本)元年（859年）に従五位、同13年（861年）には正五位下に昇進した」とある。
sen.e: According to historical document of the shrine, 'In 485, miyabashira (pillars of a shrine) were built and religious ceremony was held, and its rank advanced to Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) in 859 and Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 861.

According to historical document on the shrine, 'In 485, miyabashira (pillars of a shrine) were built and religious ceremony was held, and its rank advanced to Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) in 859 and Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 861.

According to historical document on the shrine, 'In 485, miyabashira (pillars of a shrine) were built and religious ceremony was held, and its rank advanced to Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) in 859 and Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 861.

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳においては名神大社に列せられ、また六国史所載の神社である。
sen.e: It was listed as myojin-taisha shrine in the Engishiki jinmyocho (List of Official Shrines), and is a shrine mentioned in the Rikkokushi.
It was listed as myojin-taisha shrine in the Engishiki jinmyocho (List of Official Shrines), and is a shrine mentioned in the Rikkokushi.
It was listed as myojin-taisha shrine in the Engishiki jinmyocho (List of Official Shrines), and is a shrine mentioned in the Rikkokushi (the Six National Histories).
sen.cmt: 六国史の補足を入れました。

sen.j: 1872年（明治5年）に郷社、1919年（大正8年）に府社に列せられた。
sen.e: It was listed as village shrine in 1872 and prefectural shrine in 1919.
It was listed as a village shrine in 1872 and a prefectural shrine in 1919.
It was listed as a village shrine in 1872 and a prefectural shrine in 1919.

sen.j: 五穀豊穣、養蚕および病除、安産の守護神として近隣に知られ、北陸や関西地方からの参拝者も多い。
sen.e: It is known in the neighborhood as the guardian deity for bumper crops, sericulture, disease avoidance, and easy delivery, and many visit from the Hokuriku and Kansai regions.
It is known in the neighborhood as the guardian deity for bumper crops, sericulture, disease avoidance, and easy delivery, and many visit from the Hokuriku and Kansai regions.
It is known in the neighborhood as the guardian deity for bumper crops, sericulture, disease avoidance, and easy delivery, and many visit from the Hokuriku and Kansai regions.

tit.e: Setsumatsu sha (smaller shrine managed under the shrine)

sen.j: 竈神社（澳津彦神、澳津姫神）
